T

TestCases - package TestCases
 
testGameOverAndHasNoWinnerFullBoard() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
 
testGet() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Tests if the get() method works Using the method we check if the spots exist If it exists the command returns 0 and if doesn't the return is -1
testHasWinnerColumn() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Tests if the game can be won with 5 marks in a column Four marks are placed in a column and the hasWinner method checks if the game has a winner should be False at first Afterwards a fifth marker is placed which decides a winner and checks again if there is a winner using hasWinner() The result should be True
testHasWinnerDiagonal() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Tests if the game can be won with 5 marks in a column Four marks are placed in a diagonal and the hasWinner method checks if the game has a winner should be False at first Afterwards a fifth marker is placed which decides a winner and checks again if there is a winner using hasWinner() The result should be True
testHasWinnerHorizontal() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Tests if the game can be won with 5 marks in a column Four marks are placed in a line and the hasWinner method checks if the game has a winner should be False at first Afterwards a fifth marker is placed which decides a winner and checks again if there is a winner using hasWinner() The result should be True
testIsEmpty() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Tests if the isEmpty() method works properly Test if the initial output of the method is True Then markers are put on some empty spots and should return False
testPosition() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Tests if the positions exists The positions in the test are random preselected positions
testReset() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Test if the reset() method works Markers are placed in certain spots Afterwards the board is reset and using isEmpty the previously filled spots are checked if they are now empty
testRotation() - Method in class TestCases.BoardTest
Tests if the rotation of the subboards works First markers are placed on some of the spots and after the rotations are done the new positions are checked if they are empty and should return False The test is made for all possible rotations (clockwise and counter-clockwise)
TextIO - Class in ss.utils
TextIO provides a set of static methods for reading and writing text.
TextIO() - Constructor for class ss.utils.TextIO
 
thread - Variable in class GameLogic.Game
 
thread - Variable in class GameLogic.ServerGame
 
thread - Variable in class Network.Client
a variable of type Thread which will be a separate thread for the client( the run method takes use of the buffered writer to read from ClientHandler)
thread - Variable in class Network.Server
a variable of type Thread to allow adding client handlers or removing them and checking if the server is still alive
topLeft - Variable in class GameLogic.Board
a sub board of the main board (topLeft)
topRight - Variable in class GameLogic.Board
a sub board of the main board (ropRight)
toString() - Method in class GameLogic.Board
this method makes a toString to print out the board with the indexes and board with picked moves
twoClientConnection - Variable in class Network.ClientHandler
a variable of type TwoClientConnection that can relay 2 messages to 2 clients from 1 client handler
TwoClientConnection - Class in Network
A class that establishes a connection between two client handlers in order tow transmit 2 messages to both clients
TwoClientConnection(ClientHandler, ClientHandler, Server) - Constructor for class Network.TwoClientConnection
a constructor that makes an object that knows about the two client handles that play a game
